oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath of Allegiance for Corporal J. M. Morey of the 32nd Regiment, Tennessee Infantry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document representing the oath of allegiance certificate issued to Corporal J. M. Morey of the 32nd Regiment, Tennessee Infantry, by the Union Provost Marshal's Office on June 14, 1865. It includes a physical description of the soldier followed by the notation in pencil "and is the most precious darling that ever lived. L.H.B."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Union Provost Marshal's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Corporal J. M. Morey was captured by General Sherman's men in February 1865. By April he had been placed in a Federal prison at Hart's Island, New York. This oath of allegiance was probably a condition of his release from the military prison in June 1865. L.H.B. are the initials of Louisa H. Broughton, the woman he would wed in August 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civil War in the West; Civil War society; United States - History - 1783-1865; United States - History - 1849-1877; United States History - Civil War, 1861-1865
Civil Wars; War
